pred: The Marketing suggested that the remote control could have fewer buttons or even no buttons at all, and instead use a menu-based system or a touch screen interface. They believed that most people only use a few functions on their remote controls regularly, and having too many buttons could confuse users.
answers: The Marketing thought buttons can be omitted, just like cell phones, because many of the functions of buttons, such as the TV button, are generally not used. But they can set up a menu-style button if they really need to.

pred: During the meeting, the group discussed creating a new remote control for a television that is original, trendy, and user-friendly. They also talked about minimizing the number of buttons and exploring menu-based or touchscreen options to make the remote control less crowded and more intuitive for users. They acknowledged that some functionality might not be used frequently but should still be considered in the design. They also mentioned aiming for a high battery life and ensuring the design fits in with the usual remote control stereotype to avoid a steep learning curve for new users.
answers: They wanted it to be original, trendy, user-friendly, durable, creative and characteristic, so it can be very intuitive that people could use the product. In addition, the price, cost and expected profit of the remote control were also determined. In the part of creativity, they pointed out that creativity should have its own characteristics and ensure its fashion without affecting its functionality, so as to truly "introduce fashion into electronics". In terms of function, it is necessary to simplify the switch and guarantee function.

pred: During the meeting, the team discussed the design of a new remote control for various devices. They agreed on several features including a lightweight design, not too many buttons, durability, audible feedback when buttons are pressed, an LED indicator, compatibility with multiple devices, and energy efficiency to minimize battery usage. These ideas will be further developed in the upcoming design stages.
answers: Project Manager believed that it could not be heavy. Industrial Designer indicated that fewer and bigger buttons are better and should be bust-free, for instance, rubber could be used on it. Industrial Designer also suggested that when users push a button, they could hear some sort of bleep. User Interface suggested a LED on the corner and not too expensive material like plastic could be used. Marketing added that it should look nice for better sales and should work with as many as possible of existing products listed on their website. Industrial Designer also concluded that it should be battery-saving.

pred: During the kick-off meeting for the design of a new remote control, the team discussed the importance of creating an original, trendy, and user-friendly design. The design goals included functional, conceptual, and detailed design, which the team planned to work on individually and then discuss throughout the day. The remote control was intended to be colourful, small, and user-friendly, with easy-to-use buttons and possibly adaptable features such as interchangeable frames or a recordable sequence of actions. The team aimed to sell the remote control for €25 and produce it with a cost of €12.50 or less, with a goal of selling two million units. The team agreed to meet again in thirty minutes to further discuss and decide on the most important features and technical aspects of the remote control design.
answers: The group hoped that it can be applied to children, in particular to ensure their safety during use. Besides, it should be colourful and beautiful to attract the attention of children. The price also should be reasonable and affordable, not too expensive, but the profit can be guaranteed. In terms of function design, unnecessary functions and switches should be removed to enhance their applicability.

pred: During the kick-off meeting for the design of a new remote control, the team discussed creating an original, trendy, and user-friendly remote control. They identified the importance of functional design, conceptual design, and detailed design. The team decided to work individually and then meet throughout the day to discuss their ideas. They also discussed the need for a remote control that is colourful, robust, small, and easy to use. The team considered adding features such as a history function, recordable sequences of actions, and the ability to change colours. They also discussed the possibility of creating a universal remote control with a screen. The meeting ended with the team agreeing to meet again in thirty minutes to discuss and decide on the important features and ideas for the children's remote control design.
answers: The group thought remote controls should keep children safe while using them. At the same time, the remote control should be brightly coloured. Even if it is not colourful, it should also choose a monochrome colour that children like to attract them.

pred: The marketing expert presented findings from a usability lab-test with a hundred participants, revealing that users disliked the look and feel of current remote controls and found them hard to learn how to use. They also zapped channels frequently and only used a few buttons. The younger age group was more interested in features like an LCD screen and a menu button, while the older age group was less interested in new features but spent money more easily. The market preferred a remote control that was easy to use and trendy in design, even if it added to the cost. The team decided to include a mute button and discussed whether to include more buttons or a menu on the remote control. The next phase would involve conceptual design.
answers: Marketing did a usability lab-test with a hundred people and found that users disliked the ugly look of current remote controls and the market segmentation includes different attitudes towards new functions. Users felt it hard to learn new functions and they zapped a lot. The channel switch was the most popular function while the power, volume and channel selections buttons were very relevant. The market was to be segmented to different groups and most users were between thirty-six and forty-five years old and young users had different tastes about the LCD compared to the old. The speech recognition features were welcomed by the second largest group, the young but which group they should targeted remained to be discussed. Marketing concluded that less important functions should be discarded and the device should be user friendly.

pred: During the meeting, the team discussed the functional design of the new remote control for a television. They agreed that it should be original, trendy, and user-friendly. The team suggested that instead of having numerous buttons, the remote control could have a menu-based system or a touch screen interface to reduce clutter and make it more intuitive for users. They also mentioned the importance of considering battery life and ensuring the design fits in with the usual remote control stereotype to avoid a steep learning curve for new users.
answers: The group felt that the remote control didn't need a lot of buttons,and on the basis of ensuring originality, it should also ensure conventionality and make it applicable to all kinds of groups.

pred: The team did not discuss the new idea of the Industrial Designer concerning the cover of the device in the given meeting transcript. The discussion focused on the buttons and functions of the remote control.
answers: Industrial Designer suggested having a trendy remote control with bright color, red for instance. But again, it was questioned by User Interface who were not sure about whether it would be profitable.

They also mentioned that younger people might be more interested in trendy features like changeable covers, but older people might not be as receptive to change. They did not discuss the structure of the device in detail beyond these points.
answers: There were a lot of small wires connecting the components, the battery and the switches. On the top of the remote control, there was the chip, buttons with numbers and teletext. Industrial Designer suggested that the remote control should be small and contain only one long-lasting battery to cut cost. And a bleep could be added to remind the battery usage.

The Industrial Designer was having trouble remembering the name and they went through a process of trying to locate it, eventually finding it in PowerPoint under the name 'working design'. The Project Manager then asked the Industrial Designer to save it under a specific name for future reference.
answers: Project Manager questioned the reason why not to use two batteries and Industrial Designer argued that two batteries would enlarge the size and thus, make the cost rise. Project Manager also questioned the button design.After discussion, they agreed that the menu button will only work on the newer televisions.

pred: During the meeting, the Project Manager discussed the agenda, which included reviewing minutes from the previous meeting, updates from team members, and new product requirements. The Industrial Designer presented his findings on the design of the remote control, emphasizing ease of use and cost-effectiveness. The Marketing team shared results from a usability lab-test, highlighting user preferences for design, ease of use, and features. The team discussed the potential inclusion of a menu button, LCD screen, and speech recognition, but concerns arose regarding costs. The Project Manager concluded the meeting by assigning tasks for the next phase, which is the conceptual design, and scheduling time for work after lunch.
answers: The team introduced their findings in turns and gradually came to some agreements. First, Industrial Designer introduced the structure of the device and suggested one battery and small size. Meanwhile, Project Manager questioned the cover design since it would not be cheap. Then, User Interface left a question whether the technical function should be basic or multi-functional. After that, Marketing concluded that less important functions should be discarded and the device should be user friendly. Lastly, Project Manager suggested discarding the teletext and asked for ideas about button design.

pred: During the meeting, the team discussed the new product requirements for a remote control. The team did not reach a definitive decision on the number of buttons or features, as cost was a concern. answers: Project Manager decided that the remote control should only be used on television and targeted at the biggest size of group. Corporate colour and slogan must be used on the cover. The meeting concluded with the team working on ideas individually and reconvening in thirty minutes to decide which ideas to pursue further. answers: The main points of the discussion are the design goal and price of a new television remote control project. The group first put forward the design goal of remote control. Then they got used to the whiteboard and wrote down everyone's favourite animal and their characteristics. Project manager and Marketing wanted to sell this remote control for twenty five Euro and expected profit will be around two million Euro. Then, the group thought about colour and function features of the new remote controls. pred: The Industrial Designer expressed that the design of the remote control should not stray too far from the usual designs to avoid a big learning curve for new users. They also mentioned that the design should fit in and not be like those fancy websites that are difficult to access, which seemed to be a reference to fashionable but complex designs.
answers: Industrial Designers believed that in the design of remote control, fashion should have individuality and combine with function to achieve a perfect fit between fashion and electronics. Beyond that, it should be original in order to be unique.

pred: The group discussed aiming for a remote control with a high battery life, but they also acknowledged that it shouldn't stray too far from the usual design to avoid a steep learning curve for new users. answers: They felt that the battery design should be long-lived, original, and conventional to ensure the battery's innovation, versatility, and durability. It should also not be far from the usual performance, or it may cause problems for new users.
